intro: Ferraria randii, commonly known as the "Rainbow Orchid," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its flowers are borne on tall, slender stems. Ferraria randii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
